channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 特姆优会赢得美国购物者的青睐吗？在本周的 "Money Talks "播客中，我们将问亚马逊和 Etsy 等公司应该如何担心中国电子商务巨头🎧？
item.description:
Will Temu win over American shoppers? This week on our “Money Talks” podcast, we ask how worried companies such as Amazon and Etsy should be about the Chinese e-commerce giant https://t.co/MJQ8Ac4xCA 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 26, 2024

item.title: 世界不同地区人们思维方式的差异似乎正在扩大 👇
item.description:
The differences between how people think in different parts of the world seem to be widening https://t.co/QcKvPFBexa 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 26, 2024

item.title: 大多数服用抗抑郁药物的人并不需要这种药物。找出真正需要抗抑郁药的人，并让其他人摆脱这种药物👇。
item.description:
Most people on antidepressants don’t need them. Identify those who really do—and wean other people off them https://t.co/wfyiHe0hJr 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 26, 2024

item.title: @madrid_mike 说："认为移民是拉丁裔选民的决定性问题 "是错误的。他加入了我们的 "制衡 "播客🎧。
item.description:
It’s wrong to assume “that it’s immigration that is the defining issue for the Latino voter”, says @madrid_mike. He joins our “Checks and Balance” podcast https://t.co/R1LAutmXZs 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 26, 2024

item.title: 随着精神疾病的增多，越来越多的科学家正在研究营养如何影响大脑。食物影响心理，也影响身体 👇
item.description:
With mental-health disorders rising, a growing number of scientists are investigating how nutrition influences the brain. Food affects the mind, as well as the body https://t.co/9cF0NisgQD 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 26, 2024

item.title: 阿纳姆伯格斯动物园的雄性黑猩猩又打架了。在弗兰斯-德瓦尔的注视下，一只黑猩猩向另一只黑猩猩伸出了手--仿佛在说："我们和好吧"。这种和解的景象彻底改变了这位年轻灵长类动物学家的工作👇。
item.description:
The male chimps at Burgers’ Zoo in Arnhem had been fighting again. As Frans de Waal watched, one held out his hand to the other—as if to say “Let’s make it up.”

The sight of such reconciliation changed the young primatologist’s work for good https://t.co/B2xw8I24PF 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 25, 2024

item.title: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）当选的同时，美国在国际经合组织（EIU）的一项指数中被降级为有缺陷的民主国家。但这一趋势早在他上任前几年就已开始 👇。
item.description:
America’s downgrade to flawed-democracy status in an EIU index coincided with the election of Donald Trump. But the trend was in motion years before he assumed office https://t.co/jjdDHfznik 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 25, 2024

item.title: 美国以外的公司之所以估值低，是因为它们缺乏活力，这种论点是站不住脚的。我们解释了为什么 👇
item.description:
The argument that companies outside America merit their low valuations because they lack dynamism is threadbare. We explain why https://t.co/UOZSgiMrFf 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 25, 2024

item.title: 美国人对下一任总统问题的关注程度之高令人吃惊，但他们对总统能否在其位谋其政却关注甚少。
item.description:
For all the attention that Americans pay to the question of their next president, they devote surprisingly little to whether he will be able to do much from his perch https://t.co/et8hzLPfAR 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 25, 2024

item.title: 约翰-博尔顿写道，美国总统必须找到挫败威胁和促进国家利益的方法。但乔-拜登和唐纳德-特朗普 "一再被证明无法完成这一使命"。
item.description:
American presidents must find ways to thwart threats and advance the country’s interests, writes John Bolton. But Joe Biden and Donald Trump have “repeatedly proven unable to perform this mission”, he argues in a guest essay https://t.co/slRa9m3Oln 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 25, 2024

item.title: 声称对莫斯科附近的克罗库斯市政厅袭击事件负责的组织对俄罗斯和西方的威胁与日俱增。我们将解释原因： 盖蒂图片社
item.description:
The group that claimed responsibility for the Crocus City Hall attack near Moscow is a growing threat to Russia—and the West. We explain why: https://t.co/lKlPSbEh63

Photo: Getty Images pic.twitter.com/fwWJXU5lT2

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 25, 2024

item.title: 11 月，美国人将选出他们的下一任总统。经济学人》正在追踪这场角逐。关注最新民调，阅读关于两位主要候选人的简短指南，并标记关键的选举日历日期👇。
item.description:
In November Americans will elect their next president. The Economist is tracking the contest. Follow the latest polls, read short guides on the two main candidates, and mark key electoral-calendar dates https://t.co/t8MUBZMJcE 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 25, 2024

item.title: 什么是 "伊斯兰国呼罗珊省"？声称对莫斯科附近的克罗库斯市政厅袭击事件负责的组织对俄罗斯和西方构成了日益严重的威胁。我们将解释原因。
item.description:
What is the Islamic State Khorasan Province? The group that claimed responsibility for the Crocus City Hall attack near Moscow is a growing threat to Russia—and the West. We explain why https://t.co/ZJ9k7yaIcG 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 25, 2024

item.title: 为什么要在马拉松比赛中作弊？不是为了奖牌，而是为了喜欢 👇
item.description:
Why cheat in a marathon? Not for medals but for likes https://t.co/JF8pfllf0s 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 25, 2024

item.title: 在有关英国经济政策的讨论中，财政规则（以及与之相对应的余地）是不可回避的话题。但这些规则是如何运作的，英国是否应该有这些规则呢？我写过一篇关于这个枯燥但重要的领域的文章，文章和快速主题如下：
item.description:
Fiscal rules (and headroom against them) are pretty inescapable in conversations about Britain's economic policy. But how do they work, and should the UK even have them?

I wrote on this dry-but-important area, article and quick thread below:https://t.co/AAJoGwdUxB

— Archie Hall (@ArchieHall) March 25, 2024

item.title: "困扰》是一本引人入胜的回忆录，分析了美国大学中充满争议的信仰体系。但是，它并没有成为一篇愤怒的文化战争宣言👇。
item.description:
“Troubled”, a fascinating memoir, analyses the controversial belief systems that have gripped American universities. But it does so without being an angry culture-war screed https://t.co/3t9O9tUz1I 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 25, 2024

item.title: 性问题被认为是造成五分之一到一半离婚的原因。减少这一数字将使许多成人和儿童免于痛苦和贫困👇。
item.description:
Sexual issues are thought to contribute to between a ﬁfth and half of all divorces. Reducing that number would spare many adults and children from misery and impoverishment https://t.co/BKYf6BN1zk 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 25, 2024

item.title: 一位精神分析师解释了为什么对感到 "疲惫不堪 "的人来说，仅仅尝试放松并不总是有效 👇
item.description:
A psychoanalyst explains why for people feeling “burnt out”, simply trying to relax doesn’t always work https://t.co/TrHQtAzSgt 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 25, 2024

item.title: 租房便宜还是买房便宜？我们的分析显示了近年来美国大部分地区买房和租房的相对成本是如何被颠覆的👇。
item.description:
Is it cheaper to rent or buy property? Our analysis shows how the relative costs of buying and renting have been upended throughout much of America in recent years https://t.co/S1EAndZxnq 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 25, 2024

item.title: 给慕萨卡的粉丝们：在希腊独立日，我写了一篇关于小酒馆的经典之作如何进入希腊美食神殿--以及为什么正宗在美食中是一个难以捉摸的概念的文章。经济学人
item.description:
For fans of moussaka: on Greek Independence Day, I wrote about how the taverna classic made it into the pantheon of Greek gastronomy—and why authenticity is an elusive concept in food. For @TheEconomist https://t.co/6YE5I08OVP

— Claire McQue (@ClaireemcQue) March 25, 2024

item.title: 在以往的危机之后，弗拉基米尔-普京对任何质疑其权力的声音都会做出回应，那就是把权力抓得更紧。因此，克里姆林宫无疑会以莫斯科袭击事件为借口，进一步收紧国内螺丝👇。
item.description:
After previous crises Vladimir Putin has responded to any questioning of his power by gripping it tighter. So the Kremlin will no doubt use the Moscow attack as a pretext to tighten the domestic screws further https://t.co/aUlKuHjhb4 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 25, 2024

item.title: 对工作充满热情是件好事。但你可能正沉浸在某种不完全健康的情绪中👇。
item.description:
It is great to feel passion for your job. But you may be in the grip of something that is not entirely healthy https://t.co/pxEXvnEQtK 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 25, 2024

item.title: 千百年来，人们一直根据狗的行为特征对其进行选择性繁殖。这就是为什么指路犬能指路、猎犬能寻回猎物、牧羊犬能放牧。这也是斗犬杀人的原因。XL Bully 就是斗犬的直接后裔 👇
item.description:
For millennia dogs have been selectively bred for behavioural traits. That is why pointers point, retrievers retrieve and sheep dogs herd. It’s also why fighting dogs kill.

And the XL Bully descends directly from fighting dogs https://t.co/9W3vUdLg7T 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 25, 2024

item.title: 两本新书认为，富人不利于环境，加剧了住房短缺，其中一些人还收买了政治影响力。这两本书的作者提出了设定收入和财富上限的理由，但这是一个切实可行的计划吗？ 👇
item.description:
Rich people are bad for the environment, aggravate housing shortages and some of them buy political influence, argue two new books. The authors make the case for caps on income and wealth—but is that a practical plan? https://t.co/QUiizCUzJv 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 25, 2024

item.description:

item.title: 穆罕默德-穆斯塔法是巴勒斯坦总统的经济顾问。他曾说过，他要的是 "正义、自由、安全、和平与繁荣"。但一些居民对新任命的总理究竟是在为谁的利益服务表示怀疑。
item.description:
Mohammad Mustafa was the Palestinian president’s economic advisor. He has said he wants “justice, freedom, security, peace and prosperity”.

But some residents are sceptical about whose interests their newly-appointed prime minister is serving https://t.co/T0Prw0q1mc 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 25, 2024

item.title: 几十年来，这个家庭一直显得异常殷实，但突然间却开始显得不那么殷实了 ⬇️
